sessions.topic: Introduction to conditional probability and Bayes' theorem, including prior and posterior probabilities.
Introduction to conditional probability and Bayes' theorem, including prior and posterior probabilities.
Introduction to conditional probability and Bayes' theorem, including prior and posterior probabilities.

attempts.prompt: Which best defines a posterior probability?
attempts.student_answer: B) A probability value revised by using additional information obtained later

attempts.prompt: Using P(A)=0.80, P(B)=0.15, P(C)=0.05 and defect rates P(D|A)=0.04, P(D|B)=0.06, P(D|C)=0.09, what is the overall probability P(D) that a randomly selected ELT is defective?
If an ELT is randomly selected from the general population of all ELTs, what is the probability it was made by the Altigauge Manufacturing Company?
What percentage of ELTs are made by Chartair according to the example?
How many lines are in the context?
Which character appears on every line of the context?
How many times does the digit '7' appear in the entire context?
True or False: Each line in the context shows the same single digit.
Which of the following correctly describes the number 7?
What is the Roman numeral representation of 7?
Which label fits 7?
Which of the following are divisors (factors) of 7?
Select all properties true for 7.
Which expression gives the generalized Bayes theorem for the posterior probability P(A_k | B) when there are multiple mutually exclusive categories A_1, A_2, ..., A_n?
attempts.student_answer: D) P(A_k | B) = P(B | A_k) P(B) / P(A_k)

attempts.prompt: In the generalized Bayes denominator P(B) = sum_j P(B|A_j)P(A_j), what principle is being used to compute P(B)?
attempts.student_answer: C) A simplification valid only when there are exactly two categories

attempts.prompt: In a quality-control application with several production lines each having a prior production share and a defect rate, which factor most directly determines an increased posterior probability that a defective item came from a given line?
attempts.student_answer: C) Having the largest product of prior share and defect rate relative to other lines (i.e., largest P(B|A_i)P(A_i))

attempts.prompt: Which of the following statements correctly describe consequences or features of the generalized Bayes theorem with multiple categories? (Select all that apply.)
Which conditions are required for applying the generalized Bayes formula correctly? (Select all that apply.)
Generalized Bayes theorem requires that the set of categories for event A be mutually exclusive and exhaustive.

When using generalized Bayes theorem to decide which production line produced a defective item, the posterior probability for a given line depends only on that line's prior and defect rate and is unaffected by other lines' defect rates.
Write the generalized Bayes theorem formula for P(A_k | B) using summation notation.
Briefly explain how generalized Bayes theorem is applied in quality control with multiple categories (such as production lines or batches).

Three production lines produce 50%, 30%, and 20% of items respectively. Their defect rates are 0.02, 0.05, and 0.10 respectively. Compute the posterior probability that a randomly observed defective item came from the third line. Give the value to three decimal places.
Which expression gives the generalized Bayes theorem for the posterior probability P(A_k | B) when there are multiple mutually exclusive categories A_1, A_2, ..., A_n?
attempts.student_answer: D) P(A_k | B) = P(B | A_k) P(B) / P(A_k)

attempts.prompt: In the generalized Bayes denominator P(B) = sum_j P(B|A_j)P(A_j), what principle is being used to compute P(B)?
attempts.student_answer: C) A simplification valid only when there are exactly two categories

attempts.prompt: In a quality-control application with several production lines each having a prior production share and a defect rate, which factor most directly determines an increased posterior probability that a defective item came from a given line?
attempts.student_answer: C) Having the largest product of prior share and defect rate relative to other lines (i.e., largest P(B|A_i)P(A_i))

attempts.prompt: Which of the following statements correctly describe consequences or features of the generalized Bayes theorem with multiple categories? (Select all that apply.)
Which conditions are required for applying the generalized Bayes formula correctly? (Select all that apply.)
Generalized Bayes theorem requires that the set of categories for event A be mutually exclusive and exhaustive.

When using generalized Bayes theorem to decide which production line produced a defective item, the posterior probability for a given line depends only on that line's prior and defect rate and is unaffected by other lines' defect rates.
Write the generalized Bayes theorem formula for P(A_k | B) using summation notation.
Briefly explain how generalized Bayes theorem is applied in quality control with multiple categories (such as production lines or batches).

Three production lines produce 50%, 30%, and 20% of items respectively. Their defect rates are 0.02, 0.05, and 0.10 respectively. Compute the posterior probability that a randomly observed defective item came from the third line. Give the value to three decimal places.

attempts.topic: Bayes' theorem and conditional probability: revising priors into posteriors using new information.
attempts.prompt: What is the primary purpose of Bayes' theorem as described?
attempts.student_answer: A) To compute the joint probability of two independent events only

attempts.topic: Introduction to conditional probability and Bayes' theorem, including prior and posterior probabilities.
attempts.prompt: Which choice correctly defines the terms prior probability and posterior probability?
attempts.student_answer: A) A prior probability is the initial probability before additional information; a posterior probability is the probability revised after incorporating new information.

attempts.topic: Introduction to conditional probability and Bayes' theorem, including prior and posterior probabilities.
attempts.prompt: Which statement best captures the essence of Bayes' theorem as described in the material?
attempts.student_answer: C) Bayes' theorem requires that events be independent in order to update probabilities.

attempts.topic: Introduction to conditional probability and Bayes' theorem, including prior and posterior probabilities.
attempts.prompt: State Bayes' theorem for two events A and B, giving the formula for P(A | B) in terms of P(B | A), P(A), and P(B).

attempts.topic: Introduction to conditional probability and Bayes' theorem, including prior and posterior probabilities.
attempts.prompt: Write the generalized Bayes' theorem for a partition {A_i} (i = 1,...,n) and explain in one sentence why this generalization is useful in quality control applications.
